title: Ticket #7657: Bindings constraint arguments should all support passing ExprTree
description:
The bindings Schedd method xquery allows for a classad.ExprTree to be passed as the constraint, which is useful for users who are using ExprTree to build up complex queries. The other methods which take a constraint, query, act, and edit, only allow string constraints. They should all be able to take either a string (containing an expression) or a classad.ExprTree.

Methods that take a constraint

  • Collector.query
  • Schedd.query
  • Schedd.xquery
  • Schedd.act
  • Schedd.edit
  • Schedd.history
  • Startd.drainJobs
  • Startd.history
remarks:
2020-Jul-08 14:28:53 by johnkn:
a brace of helper function was created that accepts a python object that can be a string, an ExprTreeHolder or a python native object of type None, Bool, Long, Int or Float.

One helper function converts the above into a classad::ExprTree*, the other converts the above into a constraint string (which is what most of the native c++ APIs actually consume)

-tj
